benchmark_details.name: UNIDETOX (Universal Detoxification of Large Language Models via Dataset Distillation)
benchmark_details.overview: UNIDETOX is a universally applicable method for mitigating toxicity across various large language models (LLMs) using a novel and efficient dataset distillation technique. It generates detoxifying text that can be used to universally fine-tune any LLM without model-specific hyperparameter tuning.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a universal method for detoxifying large language models using distilled detoxifying text, improving toxicity mitigation while maintaining fluency and performance.

data.source: Dynamically Generated Hate Speech (DGHS) dataset and ToxiGen dataset for evaluation.
data.size: 25,150 examples for training, 896 validation examples, and 940 test examples.
data.annotation: Detoxifying text is distilled from existing toxic data using contrastive decoding.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated using generated text continuations evaluated for toxicity and fluency.
methodology.interpretation: Lower TP and EMT scores indicate better detoxification performance.
methodology.validation: Technique validated through experiments across multiple LLMs including GPT-2, OPT, Falcon, and LLaMA2.
